headline: Netflix Reportedly Weighing Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: Netflix is actively exploring a bid for Warner bros. Discovery studio and streaming businesses, according to reports. Needham & Co. Senior Entertainment & Internet Analyst believes that a deal would be worth it for Netflix, but only at the right price. If a deal were to fall through, however, Martin also sees Netflix as still in a strong position by doing a lot of things that are trying to "maximize revenue from their IP." She joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss the deal, and what other possible buyers might be out there.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Pops After Reports Of Netflix Bid For The Studio
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery stock jumped more than 3% Friday after media reports that Netflix is exploring a bid for part of the company, according to Reuters.  Earlier this month Warner Bros. Discovery's board announced it was exploring options to sell all or part of the company.  Following the split, the newly merged Paramount Skydance had made an unsolicited bid for the studio and streaming half of WBD, according to the Wall Street Journal.

content.title: Warner Bros. Discovery Stock Pops After Reports Of Netflix Bid For The Studio
content.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery stock jumped more than 3% Friday after media reports that Netflix is exploring a bid for part of the company, according to Reuters.  Earlier this month Warner Bros. Discovery's board announced it was exploring options to sell all or part of the company.  Following the split, the newly merged Paramount Skydance had made an unsolicited bid for the studio and streaming half of WBD, according to the Wall Street Journal.

headline: Samsung, Netflix, Disney: Trending stocks
summary: Nvidia's (NVDA) deal to provide chips to South Korea lifts Hyundai (005380.KS), Samsung (005930.KS) and Naver (035420.KS) stocks. Netflix (NFLX) shares are up on a 10-to-1 share split and a report that the streaming giant is considering entering a bidding war with Paramount Skydance (PSKY) for Warner Bros Discovery (WBD). Also in streaming, Disney (DIS) channels including ESPN and ABC went dark on YouTube TV (GOOG, GOOGL) as a pricing dispute between the two companies remains unresolved. And Taylor Swift's publisher Universal Music (UMG.AS) ends a copyright lawsuit and announces a new AI music platform. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Netflix taps bank to explore bid for Warner Bros: sources
summary:
STORY: Netflix is actively exploring a bid for Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business.

Three sources told Reuters that Netflix has brought in investment bank Moelis & Co to explore the deal. 

That’s the same firm that helped Skydance Media in its successful bid for Paramount Global.

The streaming giant has also been given access to Warner Bros Discovery’s financial data, a key step in evaluating a potential offer.

Warner Bros and Moelis declined to comment, while Netflix could not be reached for comment.

Owning the studio business would give Netflix control over some of Hollywood's most successful stories and characters, including the Harry Potter and DC Comics franchises. 

:: File

Last week, Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos told investors the company evaluates acquisitions that could strengthen its content, but he said the firm had no interest in Warner Bros Discovery’s cable networks.

Warner Bros has received multiple unsolicited offers to buy the company.

Its board is also weighing whether to proceed with a planned split or consider selling all or parts of the business.
